topics.body:
It's only semi-relevant, cause I'm talking about generic fps games here for a second, but apparently call of duty sales are so down that Activision is no longer saying their actual sales, but rather they're going "there's been a billion dollars in products shipped on day one".  That's like saying that you shipped a billion dollars worth of a toy baby doll that has realistic looking plastic diarrhea; I have to highly doubt that you actually sold all those products.

FPS games for some reason year by year are constituting less and less of a percentage of the video game market.  I guess people are getting tired of fps games?
